column6: Introduction to the History of Art and Visual Culture
column7: This course introduces participants to foundational questions that shape the disciplines of art history and visual studies. It is not a comprehensive survey. Rather, it provides students critical frames for examining the visual world from various temporal, geographic, and methodological perspectives. Students will investigate the history, interpretation, and criticism of selected cultural objects, images, places, and spaces across time and around the globe.
column10: Humanities - Lit & Arts, and Cultural Studies - Western course.
